intro: Adenostyles glabra subsp. briquetii, commonly known as the smooth adenostyle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
